reuo.resources.io

Class Loader<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.io.Loader<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the type of resource being loaded
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FixedLengthLoader, IndexedLoader, SpriteDataLoader, TileDataLoader

    public abstract class Loader<R>
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the loading of a resource. Internally this uses a SoftReference to the loaded resource.

    Identifiers

    Resources are uniquely identified by an integer. Each resource must have an identifier that is unique to it's Loader. The behaviour of the loader and cache if more than one resource share the same identifier is undefined.

    Caching

    Once a resource is loaded it will be softly-referenced into the cache. If it becomes garbage collected it will be removed from the cache. isCached(int) checks if a resource is currently in the cache and getCached(int) will attempt to load a resource without accessing any data sources.

    Preparing

    When a Loader is constructed it will be prepared and ready to load. To change data sources you may invoke prepare of the implementing class. Preparing will clear the cache and initialize the Loader to use new data sources. After preparing a Loader the existing loaded resources are no longer associated with the Loader.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives, Lucas Green

      • getCapacity

        public abstract int getCapacity()
        Gets the maximum possible key of a resource.
        Returns:
        the capacity

      • get

        public abstract R get(int id)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a resource or returns a cached resource.

        Implementing classes should initialize a CacheReference if the resource was loaded successfuly.

        Parameters:
        id - the key of the resource to load
        Returns:
        the loaded resource; or null if the resource does not exist or is invalid.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there where any errors reading

      • isCached

        public boolean isCached(int id)
        Checks if a resource is currently cached. This doesn't guarantee that invoking get(int) won't load from the resource as at any time the cache may be forced to clear. To ensure that no data source is contacted use getCached(int).
        Parameters:
        id - the resource key to check the cache for
        Returns:
        true if the resource is in the cache
        See Also:
        getCached(int)

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(int id)
        Checks if a resource is valid.
        Parameters:
        id - the resource to check for validity
        Returns:
        true if the resource is valid

      • getCached

        public R getCached(int id)
        Attempts to get a resource from the cache. This will not attempt to load the resource if it's not contained in the cache but instead will return null.
        Parameters:
        id - the resource key to load from the cache
        Returns:
        the resource; or null if the resource was not in the cache

      • reset

        public void reset()
